comment.text: Involved in DNA single-strand break repair by mediating the assembly of DNA break repair protein complexes. Probably during DNA repair, negatively regulates ADP-ribose levels by modulating ADP-ribosyltransferase PARP1 activity.

Homodimer. Interacts with polynucleotide kinase (PNK), DNA polymerase-beta (POLB) and DNA ligase III (LIG3). Interacts with APTX and APLF. Interacts with APEX1; the interaction is induced by SIRT1 and increases with the acetylated form of APEX1.
Moves from the nucleoli to the global nuclear chromatin upon DNA damage.
Expressed in fibroblasts, retinal pigmented epithelial cells and lymphoblastoid cells (at protein level).
Phosphorylation of Ser-371 causes dimer dissociation. Phosphorylation by CK2 promotes interaction with APTX and APLF.
Carriers of the polymorphic Gln-399 allele may be at greater risk for tobacco- and age-related DNA damage.

disease.name: Spinocerebellar ataxia, autosomal recessive, 26
disease.description: A form of spinocerebellar ataxia, a clinically and genetically heterogeneous group of cerebellar disorders due to degeneration of the cerebellum with variable involvement of the brainstem and spinal cord. SCAR26 is a progressive disease characterized by gait and limb ataxia, loss of independent ambulation, oculomotor apraxia, and peripheral neuropathy with distal muscle weakness and areflexia.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
